page.title: 12Transport in Albrugh
page.content: Communications in Albrugh is mainly by private car. Virtually all households have one car with some having two. Public transport is limited to one shoppers bus a week and the community bus - driven by trained volunteers to the surrounding villages, Denton Harleston, Bungay and Norwich. Other outtings are organised as they are required. Children are collected and brought home form school by hired coach daily execpt for those living less than 1\ miles away who make their own way by foot or cycle or parents car. The main road serving the area is the A143 Diss to Gt Yarmouth road from which Albrurgh traffic must turn for the last mile or so. Very little walking is done in the area and footpaths are fast becoming over grown and lost.
